metadata.title: CVE-2018-16515 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Matrix Synapse before 0.33.3.1 allows remote attackers to spoof events and possibly have unspecified other impacts by leveraging improper transaction and event signature validation.

notes.note: msalvatore> This CVE covers a few problems. To exploit the first, you must be "the administrator of any server in a room". To exploit the second two requires a "malicious server".

criterions.comment: matrix-synapse package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.99.2-1').
